newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russia's Komitek Oil scraps foreign ownership limit.
newsitem.headline: Russia's Komitek Oil scraps foreign ownership limit.

text.p: Russia's KomiTEK oil company, parent of oil producer Komineft, said on Friday shareholders had voted to scrap a rule limiting foreign ownership to 15 percent.
"We had a 15 percent limitation in our previous charter; now it's no longer there," KomiTEK spokesman Felix Gelman said by telephone.
He also said shareholders had approved in principle a motion to boost authorised capital by five billion roubles. Current capital is about 1.66 billion roubles.

"A decision on issuing shares within the declared limits will be taken by the board of directors," Gelman said. He did not specify when any possible issue might occur or whether such an issue would be a bonus issue or raise new funds.
Gelman was speaking after KomiTEK's extraordinary shareholders' meeting.

KomiTEK owns 51 percent of Komineft, its main production unit. KomiTEK accounted for about 1.5 percent of Russia's total crude oil output and exports in 1995, the last year for which percentage comparison figures were immediately available.
